fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.http

Interface IAddress


  • public interface IAddress
    Represents the parsed path of a IHttpServiceCall.

    In the example "/path/to/a/foo.txt", "path", "to", and "a" will be interpreted as items in a list (in that order) of the parsed path. Using the same example, the parsed item would be "file.txt", the file name would be "foo", and the extension would be "txt". There is no requirement to use file extensions for all addresses.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be immutable and therefore completely thread-safe.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IHttpService.createAddress(CharSequence), IHttpServiceCall.getAddress()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getFileBaseName()
      Gets the item as a file name, excluding any extension.
      String getFileExtension()
      Gets the filename extension (in lowercase), if the request specified an item with a file extension.
      String getFileName()
      Gets the part of the address following the last occurrence of "/" in the address.
      String getFilePath()
      Gets the path part of the address, from the start of the address to the start of the file name.
      List<String> getPathItems()
      Gets an ordered list (from the root towards the parsed item) of path segments, where segments are separated by "/" before parsing.
      boolean isBasePath()
      Indicates if this address represents the collection URI with no path corresponding to the top-level directory of the server endpoint.
      boolean isCollection()
      Indicates if this address represents a collection URI.

    • Method Detail

      • getPathItems

        List<String> getPathItems()
        Gets an ordered list (from the root towards the parsed item) of path segments, where segments are separated by "/" before parsing. Any string following the last "/" will not be included in the list, the trailing string is available via getFileName().

        Segments in the returned list are not URL-encoded.

        Returns:
        a list of zero, one, or more path segments (never null). Segments may be empty strings but will never be null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFileName(), isCollection()

      • getFileName

        String getFileName()
        Gets the part of the address following the last occurrence of "/" in the address. You can also access this information via getFileBaseName() and getFileExtension() if this is helpful (not all items will have extensions, especially for RESTful data resources).

        The returned item is not URL-encoded.

        Returns:
        the parsed item. May be empty (for collection URIs) but is never null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFileBaseName(), getFileExtension(), isCollection()

      • getFilePath

        String getFilePath()
        Gets the path part of the address, from the start of the address to the start of the file name. The file name is not included.

        The path is URL-encoded as per IETF RFC 3986.

        Returns:
        the file path, starting and ending with "/". Non-ASCII characters are URL-encoded using UTF-8.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getFileBaseName

        String getFileBaseName()
        Gets the item as a file name, excluding any extension. An extension is the trailing substring after the last occurrence of "." in the parsed item string.

        The name is URL-encoded as per IETF RFC 3986.

        Returns:
        the filename, with the exact character case used in the request. May be empty but never null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFileName(), getFileExtension()

      • getFileExtension

        String getFileExtension()
        Gets the filename extension (in lowercase), if the request specified an item with a file extension. An extension is the trailing substring after the last occurrence of "." in the parsed item string.

        The extension is URL-encoded as per IETF RFC 3986.

        Returns:
        the file extension, in lowercase. May be empty but never null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFileName(), getFileBaseName()

      • isCollection

        boolean isCollection()
        Indicates if this address represents a collection URI. A collection URI is an address ending with "/", with no filename.
        Returns:
        true if this address represents a collection (such as a directory) and has no filename.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isBasePath()

      • isBasePath

        boolean isBasePath()
        Indicates if this address represents the collection URI with no path corresponding to the top-level directory of the server endpoint. The base collection URI is an exact match for the address "/", with no filename, relative to the base path.
        Returns:
        true if this address represents the application context address "/", otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isCollection(), IHttpEndPoint.getBasePath()
